item.title: UE Procedure Related to Sidelink(36.213)
item.description: PSSCH UE procedure for transmitting PSSCH UE procedure for receiving PSSCH UE procedure for determining resource block pool for PSSCH in sidelink transmission mode 3 and 4 PSCCH UE procedure for transmitting PSCCH For sidelink transmission mode 3, the UE shall determine the subframes and resource blocks for transmitting SCI format 1 as follows: + SCI format 1 is transmitted in two PRBs per slot in each subframe where the corresponding PSSCH is transmitted + If UE receives DCI format 5A in subframe $n$ with CRC scrambled by SL-V-RNTI, one transmission of PSCCH is in the PSCCH resources $L{Init}$ in the first subframe that is included in $(t{0}^{SL},t{1}^{SL},t{2}^{SL},…))$ and that starts not earlier than $T{DL}-\frac{N{TA}}{2}\cdot Ts+(4+m)\cdot 10^{-3}$.

item.title: Agreements of NR-V2X (WI Stage)
item.description: 1. RAN1#96b (2019-04) 1.1. Physical layer structure for sidelink Agreements: Polar code adopted for Rel-15 NR DCI is applied to PSCCH. LDPC codes used for Rel-15 NR DL-SCH is applied to a transport block delivered by PSSCH. Agreements: The starting symbol and the number of symbols for a PSCCH are assumed to be known to the receiving UE before decoding the PSCCH. Agreements: For the purpose of evaluation of PSCCH design, RAN1 assumes 60 bits, 90 bits, 120 bits as the total SCI sizes including 24 bits CRC.

item.title: Agreements of NR-V2X(SI Stage)
item.description: 1. RAN1#94 (2019-08) 1.1. Sidelink design 1.1.1. Suport of unicast,groupcast and broadcast Agreements: RAN1 assumes that higher layer decides if a certain data has to be transmitted in a unicast, groupcast, or broadcast manner and inform the physical layer of the decision. For a transmission for unicast or groupcast, RAN1 assumes that the UE has established the session to which the transmission belongs to. Note that RAN1 has not made agreement about the difference among transmissions in unicast, groupcast, and broadcast manner.
